title: Pound slips on Brexit uncertainty - as it happened | Business | The Guardian
summary: wall street dips in early trading .
tourists flock to uk after pound 's brexit plunge .
athens awaits outcome of german election .
cbi : uk manufacturing growth slowed in q3
uber says it will challenge tfl decision .
uber loses london licence in shock decision by tfl .

documents.title: closing summary
text: before we close up for the day , here is a summary of the major developments today .
investors were in cautious mood as they awaited the contents of theresa may 's brexit speech in florence .
we have live updates on the speech here .
the pound is currently down against both the euro and the dollar .
losses against the dollar have accelerated , with the pound down 0.6 % dipping just below the $ 1.35 mark .
against the euro , the pound is down 0.8 % at €1.1275 .
so it seems traders are not feeling confident about britain 's brexit position , although the reaction to the speech by eu officials will be crucial .
european markets are mixed .
the ftse 100 has reversed those small losses earlier on and is now up 0.6 % or 45 points at 7,308 .
in the eurozone , better-than-expected pmi surveys for the manufacturing and services sector suggested growth in the region up to 0.7 % in the third quarter from 0.6 % in the second .
the big corporate news was the shock decision by transport for london to deny uber a new licence to operate in london .
uber said it would challenge the decision .
that 's all for today .
thank you for joining us and for all your comments .
have a great weekend , and please join us again on monday .
am

documents.title: wall street dips in early trading
text: us markets have opened slightly down : dow jones : -0.1 % at 22,345 s & p 500 : -0.1 % at 2,497 nasdaq : -0.3 % at 6,402
london 's black cab drivers have praised tfl and the london mayor sadiq khan , over the uber decision .
jim kelly , chairman of of london 's unite union black cab section , said it was the right thing to do to put the safety of passengers above the corporate interests of uber .
no one is above the law and today 's decision will be welcomed by london 's trusted professional black cab drivers .
it signals that the mayor of london and transport for london are not prepared to allow london to become the 'wild west ' of the cab trade and put passengers at risk .
in the coming weeks uber will no doubt throw all its legal and corporate lobbying might to overturn this decision .
we would urge the mayor of london and transport for london to stand firm and continue to stand up for the safety of londoners and the capital 's trusted cabbies .

business lobby group the cbi has issued a statement in support of uber , after transport for london said it would not renew the taxi company 's london licence : tom thackray , the cbi 's innovation director : broadening consumer choice through innovation is an important part of our economy and has created new opportunities that are valued by many .
it 's not in the interests of our economy , people in london and in this case , drivers , to restrict new products and services .
both uber and tfl recognise the vital importance of customer safety .
reaching a sensible agreement that allows services to continue will matter to the millions of consumers and thousands of drivers who use the app .

documents.title: tourists flock to uk after pound 's brexit plunge
text: big ben , london figures published earlier by the office for national statistics show britain is more appealing as a holiday destination since the sharp fall in the value of the pound triggered by the brexit vote .
overseas tourists made a record 4 million visits to the uk in july , an increase of 6 % on last year .
the amount they spent rose by 3 % to £ 2.7bn .
european and american visitors came in the greatest numbers , encouraged by the strength of both the euro and the dollar against the pound .

guy ellison from investec wealth and investment said the record tourist numbers would have boosted uk attractions over the summer : the in in-bound tourism is welcome , with london likely to have been the prime beneficiary .

it was always anticipated that in-bound tourism would see a material up in 2017 thanks to the sharp devaluation of sterling , though the terrorist attacks in london undoubtedly deterred some visitors .
expect the international hotel brands to have benefitted from stronger occupancy , with perhaps some spill-over impact to the uk 's independent hotel names and the likes of whitbread 's premier inn .
merlin , with its cluster of tourist attractions in london ( the eye , tussauds etc . )

and other sited within range of the capital ( legoland ) should also have benefitted from a in visitor numbers - though the less clement weather over august may have dampened demand for outdoor attractions .
uk draws record overseas tourists after pound 's brexit plunge read more

documents.title: athens awaits outcome of german election
text: german chancellor angela merkel at an election campaign event of the christian democratic union for sunday 's election .

the outcome of the election is being closely watched in greece over to greece now , where the german election over the weekend will be closely watched amid mounting anticipation the outcome will likely affect athens ' bid for debt relief .
helena smith reports .
the last time germany went to the polls in 2013 , greece dominated the agenda .
greece 's epic struggle to remain in the eurozone , its dependency on bailout funds and the saga of enforcing often draconian reforms , electrified public debate .
this time even the rightwing , anti-euro alternative fur deutschland ( afd ) party is n't bothering much about greece .
but the election is being closely followed in athens where the governing syriza party is openly backing the leftwing die linke .

the party of the german left , die linke , has been the force that in the most difficult moments for our country stood by the greek people irrespective of political cost , '' syriza said in a statement .

in such critical elections for the future , not only of germany but the european union , with the threat of a reinforced far right as never before in germany , those who demand an end to the pan-european policies of austerity must be supported . ''

there are fears that the result could impact on the country 's ability to achieve a debt write off , and recover economically , if conservative voices among chancellor angela merkel 's christian democrats , and the liberal free democrats - the cdu 's likely coalition partner - are strengthened by the vote .

documents.title: cbi : uk manufacturing growth slowed in q3
text: while tfl revealed it would not be renewing uber 's london licence , the cbi published its latest industrial trends report .
the business lobby group said the pace of growth in uk manufacturing output eased in the third quarter , but the outlook remains strong '' .

from the report : the survey of 429 manufacturers found that while output growth slowed last quarter , largely driven by the food and drink sector , the rate of growth remained well above the long-run average .
respondents expect output growth to bounce back next quarter , broadly matching the robust pace seen in the three months to july and august .
both total orders books and export order books remained strong , although total order books softened somewhat on august .
the deterioration was relatively broad-based with 9 of the 17 sub-sectors reporting a decline relative to august .
here is the full statement on the uber decision from sadiq khan , mayor of london : sadiq khan ( @ sadiqkhan ) providing an innovative service must not be at the expense of londoners safety .
my response to @ twitterid 's uber decision .

some twitter reaction to the uber decision : matthew gwyther ( @ matthewgwyther ) i suspect that the london mayor is going to find out that many londoners are not as anti-uber as he and black cabbies are wizann team ( @ wizann ) really positive news today about uber !
tea and coffee free at wizann today .
keep working everyone more black cabs needed out there !
tom thorogood ( @ tomthorogood ) i do n't use uber that much tbh but can someone think of the south londoners in this ?
black cabs do n't go south ffs .

documents.title: uber says it will challenge tfl decision
text: uber says it will immediately '' challenge the decision by transport for london to deny the cab company a new licence to operate in the capital .

tom elvidge , general manager of uber in london : 3.5 million londoners who use our app , and more than 40,000 licensed drivers who rely on uber to make a living , will be astounded by this decision .
by wanting to ban our app from the capital transport for london and the mayor have caved in to a small number of people who want to restrict consumer choice .
if this decision stands , it will put more than 40,000 licensed drivers out of work and deprive londoners of a convenient and affordable form of transport .
to defend the livelihoods of all those drivers , and the consumer choice of millions of londoners who use our app , we intend to immediately challenge this in the courts .
read our full story on the decision here : uber stripped of london licence read more

documents.title: uber loses london licence in shock decision by tfl
text: uber has been denied a new licence to operate in london major news from uber the taxi hailing company has been denied a new licence to operate in london , on the grounds that it is not a fit and proper '' operator according to transport for london .
the current licence expires on 30 september but uber has 21 days to appeal and can continue to operate until that process expires .

tfl says uber 's approach and conduct demonstrate a lack of corporate responsibility in relation to a number of issues which have potential public safety and security implications '' , such as reporting serious criminal offences , obtaining medical certificates and other issues .
the transport group has published its full statement on twitter : transport for london ( @ tfl ) tfl has today informed uber that it will not be issued with a private hire operator licence .

documents.title: mario draghi urges europe to tackle youth unemployment
text: mario draghi mario draghi , the president of the european central bank , has used a keynote speech at trinity college in dublin to warn about the dangers of youth unemployment and urge action .
he pointed out that having reached a peak of 24 % in 2013 , youth unemployment fell back to about 19 % last year .
but that is still four percentage points higher than it was in 2007 , when the financial crisis began to unfold .

we have seen how in several countries the weight of the crisis has fallen disproportionately on the young people , leaving a legacy of failed hopes , anger and ultimately mistrust in the values of our society and in the identity of our democracy .
some say that a more equitable distribution of income and wealth is the answer and that it would bring those who have lost out from globalisation back into our compact .
but that can not be enough for the young people who are the future of our democracies .
they do not want to live on subsidies .
they want to work and expand their lifetime opportunities .
today after the crisis , governments know how to respond to their quest , and how to create an environment where their hopes have a chance .
they should do so : for the future of their countries ' youth and of their democracy .
ecb ( @ ecb ) mario draghi speech : youth unemployment in the euro area
the guardian 's politics blog is up and running .
my colleague andrew sparrow is providing live updates in the build-up to theresa may 's crucial speech in florence .
follow the blog here : theresa may to outline uk 's brexit future in vital florence speech - live updates read more

documents.title: european markets subdued in morning trading
text: it 's fairly quiet this morning on europe 's major markets as investors take a breather ahead of theresa may 's brexit speech this afternoon .

the latest scores : ftse 100 : -0.2 % at 7,251 germany 's dax : +0.1 % at 12,610 france 's cac : +0.3 % at 5,282 italy 's ftse mib : +0.1 % at 22,521 spain 's ibex : -0.02 % at 10,295 europe 's stoxx 600 : -0.1 % at 383

documents.title: pound dips against euro ahead of may 's speech
text: traders are in cautious mood ahead of theresa may 's crucial speech this afternoon .
the pound is now down 0.5 % against the euro at €1.1312 .
meanwhile earlier gains against the dollar have evaporated , with the pound down just a touch by 0.03 % at $ 1.3573 .
analysts are expecting potentially big moves in the pound - in either direction - later in the trading session , once may 's speech is underway and reaction among eu officials becomes clear .

documents.title: eurozone ends q3 on a high , pmi signals
text: the eurozone flash pmi for september signalled a in growth in the region to 0.7 % in the third quarter , from 0.6 % in the second , authors of the report said the eurozone economy ended the third quarter on a high note , with private sector accelerating in september according to the ihs markit flash pmi survey .

authors of the report said the surveys , which look at the performance of the services and manufacturing sectors , suggested eurozone growth up to 0.7 % in the third quarter , from 0.6 % in the second .

chris williamson , chief business economist at ihs markit : the eurozone economy ended the summer with a burst of activity , with the pmi signalling renewed impetus to already-impressive rates of growth of output , order books and employment during september .
the survey data point to 0.7 % gdp growth for the third quarter , with accelerating momentum boding well for a buoyant end to the year .
the headline eurozone pmi numbers : eurozone flash manufacturing pmi rose to 58.2 in september from 57.4 in august .
it beat expectations of 57.1 growth also accelerated in the services sector , with the eurozone flash services pmi climbing to 55.6 this month from 54.7 in august .
economists were predicting no change the relative strength of both sectors pushed the eurozone flash composite pmi to 56.7 in september , from 55.7 in august , again beating expectations

documents.title: germany 's manufacturing sector booms in september
text: angela merkel visits a factory in oranienburg , germany german 's reputation as an industrial powerhouse was well earned in september as the manufacturing sector grew at the fastest rate in nearly six-and-a-half years in september .
that 's according to the ihs markit flash manufacturing pmi .
the services sector was also stronger than expected this month .
the headline numbers : german flash manufacturing pmi rose to 60 in september from 59.3 in august .
growth had been expected to dip slightly , with economists forecasting a headline number of 59 growth in the services sector also up , with the german flash services pmi rising to 55.6 from 53.5 .
that beat expectations of 53.8 the two surveys combined pushed the german flash composite pmi to a near six-and-a-half-year high of 57.8 from 55.8 in august .

phil smith , principal economist at ihs markit puts the numbers in context : september 's pmi survey showed germany 's private sector economy in rude health , highlighting strong broad-based growth in both business activity and employment .
our forecast of 0.7 % gdp growth in the third quarter remains well within the realms of possibility .

documents.title: growth accelerates in french private sector
text: closely-watched business surveys for the french manufacturing and services sectors have easily beaten expectations .
composite : none the ihs markit flash pmi surveys for september suggest the private sector in europe 's second largest economy ended the third quarter on a high .
the services sector was particularly strong .
here are the headline numbers ( anything above 50 signals growth ) : french flash services pmi jumped to 57.1 in september from 54.9 in august .
economists were forecasting weaker growth at 54.8 french flash manufacturing pmi rose to 56 in september from 55.8 in the previous month .

that beat economists ' forecasts of 55.5 the strength in both sectors pushed the french composite flash pmi , which combines both , to 57.2 in september from 55.2 in august , again beating expectations alex gill , economist at ihs markit : according to the latest flash pmi data , the french private sector 's 2017 revival continued in september .
indeed , the resurgence gained momentum with growth of output and new orders hitting near six-and-a-half year highs .
encouragingly , private sector growth appears to be broad-based , with similar rates of expansion recorded in both the manufacturing and services sectors .

documents.title: asian markets fall after renewed threat from north korea
text: asian markets are largely in the red after north korea threatened to test a hydrogen bomb in the pacific ocean .
earlier the north korean leader , kim jong-un , said president trump would pay dearly '' for his threat to totally destroy '' the regime .

japan braces as north korea threatens hydrogen bomb test in pacific read more here is how it 's looking in asia : nikkei : -0.25 % at 20,296 topix : -0.3 % at 1,665 hang seng : -0.7 % at 27,907 kospi 200 : -0.5 % at 317 sensex : -1.1 % at 32,029

documents.title: the agenda : pound holds steady ahead of may 's speech ; eurozone pmis ; draghi speaks in dublin
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the world economy , the financial markets , the eurozone and business .
the pound is steady this morning ahead of theresa may 's highly anticipated brexit speech in florence .
it is currently trading down a touch against the dollar , at $ 1.3566 .
the content of the prime minister 's speech this afternoon will have a major bearing on whether or not the pound can hold on to its recent strength .

michael hewson , chief market analyst at cmc , explains : whether the pound can continue its recent rebound is likely to depend on how markets receive prime minister theresa may 's speech in florence later today , when she is expected to put forward the uk government 's latest proposals to move the currently stalled talks with the eu .

she is expected to make proposals on the rights of eu citizens , as well as making a budget proposal that will ensure that there is no budget shortfall for the remainder of the current eu budget period , which goes up to 2020 .

the offer is likely to be conditional on continued transitional access to the single market and customs union over the same period , while there could be a request to open talks on trade , something that in the case of the irish border is interlinked .
a transition arrangement would also help in buying more time to come to a more comprehensive deal .
if the markets like what they hear and there is n't a negative response from the eu then the recent rally in the pound could extend further .
theresa may to ask eu to be 'creative ' about brexit in florence speech read more also coming up today 8.00am bst : flash pmi surveys for manufacturing and services in france .
the reports are expected to show reasonable growth in the private sector in september , albeit at a slower pace than in august .
8.30am bst : flash pmi surveys for manufacturing and services in germany .
the equivalent pmi reports for europe 's largest economy are expected to show a slight easing of the pace of growth in september .
9.00am bst : flash eurozone pmi surveys for manufacturing and services will provide an overview of how the private sector in the single-currency bloc performed in september .
9.30am bst : mario draghi , president of the european central bank , will give a keynote speech at trinity college in dublin , ireland .
as ever , economists and investors will be listening out for any hints on the pace and timing of monetary stimulus withdrawal .
11am bst : the cbi 's industrial trends report for september will provide the latest snapshot of how the uk 's manufacturing sector is performing in the face of brexit negotiation uncertainty .

Theresa May to ask EU to be 'creative' in Florence speech.
